message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DL, cs.LG. 

This paper discusses the creation of a shared ontology for literary themes, which can be used for computational searching and indexing of large corpora. This falls under the intersection of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which is covered by the sub-categories cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The use of collaborative and algorithmic analyses of literary themes also suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (AI), which is covered by the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Additionally, the ontology is based on the authors' own analyses, reference books, and online sources, which may involve the use of deep learning (DL) and machine learning (ML) techniques, covered by the cs.DL (Machine Learning) sub-category. Finally, the ontology can be used for media annotation and information retrieval, which suggests the involvement of large-scale data processing and analysis, covered by the cs.LG (Machine Learning and Statistics) sub-category.
